title: Young airmen: new strength for the RAAF
creator_contributor_role: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force, production company

Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Radio engineers
description: The training of 16-year-old men as radio engineers at Melbourne Technical College. This info-documentary highlights the training and education of young men to join the air force. They are trained in radio, morse code and other techniques to allow them to detect enemy planes in darkness. "Radio technology is the tool of the future for communication" (1950). Photography: Geoff Thompson.
